description: Visualize the recursive construction of the Levy C Curve. Start with a line, replace with two lines forming a right angled triangle hypotenuse, and repeat recursively to reveal the fractal behavior. Theme: Neon Cyberpunk.
Show a simple wave form and animate its extrapolation over time or space, possibly visualizing the prediction error or pattern continuation. Keep it abstract and visual.
Visualize the Recam√°n's sequence using semi-circles on a number line. Show the 'step back if positive and new, else step forward' rule creating the chaotic yet ordered pattern.
General iterated function system visualization. Show a shape repeatedly transformed (scaled/rotated/translated) to form a complex pattern like a fern or tree.
Demonstrate how rotating circles (epicycles) attached to each other can trace out complex shapes. Show a simple drawing being traced by these circles.
Visualize the folding of the Dragon Curve. Start with a strip of paper concept (folding in half), then unfold to show the 90-degree turns building the fractal.
Start with a triangle. Recursively add smaller triangles to the middle third of each side. Zoom in to show the infinite perimeter but finite area property.
Show the construction of the Sierpinski Triangle, either by removing center triangles recursively or by the 'Chaos Game' (random point dotting).
Visualize two wave sources (like ripples in a pond) overlapping. Highlight the constructive (bright) and destructive (dark) interference regions.
Plot integers in a spiral. Highlight the prime numbers to reveal the diagonal patterns. Zoom out to show the structure.
Visualize the space-filling Hilbert Curve. Show iterations 1 through 6 filling a 2D square completely without crossing itself.
